column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Chi
#Text=: The two Koreas do the military parade almost routinely .
#Text=South Korea will have a similar parade again when there is a new government in five years .
#Text=It is unlikely the kind of parade to influence further hostility .
#Text=You
#Text=: No , this is just symbolic .
#Text=As a matter of fact , North Korea is very anxious to escape from the current gridlock and [ the ] US and South Korea do not give them plenty of reasons to go to the negotiating table .
#Text=File photo of interviewee Sue Mi Terry . Image : Sue Mi Terry .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=Do you think it is likely that North and South Korea may at some point in the near future be engaged in direct military action with each other ?
#Text=Kelly
#Text=: Minor skirmishes are possible , indeed likely , given the border confusion in the Yellow Sea .
#Text=But a major conflict is highly unlikely , no matter what bluster comes from NK .
#Text=The NKs would lose such a war , decisively in fact , and the NK elite would face the hangman in the South afterward .
#Text=NK is much too far behind to win .
#Text=So full-scale conflict is very unlikely .
#Text=Kosal
#Text=: I hope not .
#Text=Ledyard
#Text=: No. A year or two ago there was a naval incident that occurred in the West Sea , but both sides separated quickly , although the North shelled an island claimed by both the DPRK and the ROK .
#Text=Neither side has anything to gain from any such incident .
#Text=Terry

#Text=: The North 's latest tactic — to return to diplomacy after provoking Seoul and Washington earlier this year — does not mean that the North has abandoned its timeworn brinkmanship strategy nor that it has shifted its nuclear policy .

#Text=The North is likely to pursue more aggressive action down the road , attempting to ratchet up another sense of crisis , if it determines that its current peace ploy is not getting the concessions it seeks from Seoul .

#Text=But while the North may provoke Seoul again with border skirmishes , or another missile or nuclear test , I think it will avoid direct military action with Seoul that will escalate to an all-out conflict .
#Text=Again , Pyongyang will not risk outright hostilities that will lead to an all-out war .
#Text=Chi
#Text=: You can never exclude possible exchanges of military actions within a limited range .
#Text=At the time of North Korean attack on Yeonpyeong Island in November 2011 , the South Korean Government made an official pledge to retaliate against any future military actions by North Korea .
#Text=The government will face grave political consequences if it fails to live up to its own words .
#Text=There is always a possibility of direct military actions but they will be more or less contained to a local level .
#Text=You
#Text=: No , I would not think so .
#Text=North Korea is more desperate to engage in a dialogue with South Korea and [ the ] US but they look for justification to go to the table .
#Text=However , [ the ] Park government and US would not be simply welcoming them to the negotiating table .
#Text=When they negotiate , they would be not generous or lenient to take all the North Korean offers .
